DOC.brief_summary: This research study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of a study drug called TGR-1202 in combination with another study drug called ublituximab compared to TGR-1202 alone as a possible treatment for Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma (DLBCL) that has come back or that has not responded to standard treatment.
DOC.brief_title: Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Ublituximab + TGR-1202 and TGR-1202 Alone in Patients With Previously Treated Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of Diffuse Large BCell Lymphoma Relapsed or refractory to prior standard therapy and subjects who are not candidates for highdose therapy or autologous stem cell transplant Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) score of 0 to 2 Any major surgery, chemotherapy or immunotherapy within the last 21 days Evidence of hepatitis B virus, hepatitis C virus or known HIV infection Autologous hematologic stem cell transplant within 3 months of study entry. Prior Allogeneic hematologic stem cell transplant is excluded Prior therapy with a PI3K delta inhibitor
